Literature Review: The Anolis lizard has emerged as a biological model system following decades of intensive study, providing new insights into ecology and evolution. This review aims to synthesize recent research on Anolis lizards, highlighting their role in challenging long-standing paradigms and opening new areas of inquiry. The study of Anolis lizards has advanced our understanding of ecological communities, evolutionary repeatability, and the impact of human activities on species and ecosystems. We will discuss the evolution of Anolis lizards, their behavior, and their role in the Anthropocene, as well as the methodological developments that have enabled this research. Our review will also examine the limitations of Anolis as a model system and the potential applications of this research in ecology and evolution.
